40 
41 /** Set the underlying ID3D12Resource for a halide_buffer_t. The memory backing
42  * the resource should be managed by the caller (via a default/device heap) and
43  * must be large enough to cover the extent of the halide_buffer_t. The device
44  * field of the halide_buffer_t must be NULL when this routine is called. This
45  * call can fail due to running out of memory or if an invalid D3D12 resource is
46  * passed. The device and host dirty bits are left unmodified. */
47 extern int halide_d3d12compute_wrap_buffer(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf, uint64_t d3d12_resource);
48 
49 /** Disconnect a halide_buffer_t from the ID3D12Resource it was previously
50  * wrapped around. Should only be called for a halide_buffer_t that
51  * halide_d3d12compute_wrap_buffer was previously called on. Frees any
52  * storage associated with the binding of the halide_buffer_t and the
53  * buffer, but does not free the ID3D12Resource. The dev field of the
54  * halide_buffer_t will be NULL on return.
55  */
56 extern int halide_d3d12compute_detach_buffer(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
57 
58 /** Return the underlying ID3D12Resource for a halide_buffer_t. This resource
59  * must be valid on an D3D12 device, unless halide_buffer_t has no associated
60  * resource. If there is no device memory (device field is NULL), returns 0.
61  */
62 extern uintptr_t halide_d3d12compute_get_buffer(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
63 
64 struct halide_d3d12compute_device;
65 struct halide_d3d12compute_command_queue;
66 
67 /** This prototype is exported as applications will typically need to
68  * replace it to get Halide filters to execute on the same device and
69  * command queue used for other purposes. The halide_d3d12compute_device is an
70  * ID3D12Device and halide_d3d12compute_command_queue is an ID3D12CommandQueue.
71  * No reference counting is done by Halide on these objects. They must remain
72  * valid until all off the following are true:
73  * - A balancing halide_d3d12compute_release_context has occurred for each
74  * halide_d3d12compute_acquire_context which returned the device/queue
75  * - All Halide filters using the context information have completed
76  * - All halide_buffer_t objects on the device have had
77  * halide_device_free called or have been detached via
78  * halide_d3d12compute_detach_buffer.
79  * - halide_device_release has been called on the interface returned from
80  * halide_d3d12compute_device_interface(). (This releases the programs on the context.)
81  */
82 extern int halide_d3d12compute_acquire_context(void *user_context, struct halide_d3d12compute_device **device_ret,
83  struct halide_d3d12compute_command_queue **queue_ret, bool create);
84 
85 /** This call balances each successfull halide_d3d12compute_acquire_context call.
86  * If halide_d3d12compute_acquire_context is replaced, this routine must be replaced
87  * as well.
88  */
89 extern int halide_d3d12compute_release_context(void *user_context);
90
